main event: A sighting of a large red fireball observed in Yakima, Washington, on December 18, 1957.
interesting points: The fireball appeared suddenly and had a diameter of 2 to 3 feet,The fireball left contrails as it moved southwest at high speed,There was an explosion associated with the sighting, followed by a ball of smoke that lasted until sundown,The observer commented that it was undoubtedly a meteor coinciding with the Geminid meteor shower,Multiple reports of similar sightings in the region were noted from different aircraft.
witness description: source was civilian, no specific witnesses mentioned
